title: Religious diversity in North America in 2010 , by religion
summary: This is a bar chart representing Religion in the x axis and Percentage of population in the y axis.
Religion Christians has the highest Percentage of population and Muslims has the lowest Percentage of population.
The Percentage of population of Religion Christians is 77.0% larger than the minimum value at Muslims.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Religion in the x axis and Percentage of population in the y axis.
The Percentage of population is appeared to be the highest at Religion Christians and lowest at Religion Muslims.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Religion in the x axis and Percentage of population in the y axis.
Religion Christians has the highest Percentage of population and Muslims has the lowest Percentage of population.
The Percentage of population of Religion Christians is 77.0% larger than the minimum value at Muslims.
max_summary: This bar chart has 7 columns on the x axis representing Religion, and Percentage of population in each Religion on the y axis.
The Percentage of population is highest at Religion Christians and lowest at Religion Muslims.
Religion Unaffiliated has the second highest value for Percentage of population.
The highest Religion Christians has 76.0 more Percentage of population than the lowest Religion Muslims.
Percentage of population at Religion Christians is 77.0 , second place is Unaffiliated at 17.0, and thirdly is Jews at 2.0.
Similar Percentage of population is found in Religion Muslims, Other religions, Hindus, and Buddhists.
The highest value 77.0 at Christians is almost 5.39 times larger than the average value 14.29.
